document_data.caption: The Thirsty Traveler's kitchens.
document_data.name: The Thirsty Traveler
document_data.mainbody: '''The Thirsty Traveler''' was a popular tavern and an eatery in the hamlet of [[Skull Crag]] in the [[Storm Horn Mountains]] of [[Cormyr]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: The tavern was located next-door to the east to caravan stables wafting a delightful aroma of fresh [[manure]].
document_data.Services: The Thirsty Traveler catered to caravaners and their hireling offers them well-deserved slake and grub after a long and dangerous road across the mountains. The tavern's kitchens were ran by a singe haggish old woman who did not tolerate anyone invading her domain.
document_data.History: In the mid-14{{th}} century DR, the Thirsty Traveler was a well-renowned establishment, popular among the travelers of the [[High Road (Cormyr)|High Road]]. During that time, the tavern was visited by a group pf caravan guards who would later become the heroes of Skull Crag.
